body_html:
Add the following to your path:
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.8

I added the following to .bashrc
export PATH=/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.8${PATH:+:${PATH}}

All cc1 and cc1plus errors are now gone during basel compile.

FYI, I also compiled basel 0.14.1 using gcc-4.8 as well, not sure if this is necessary. This alone did not cure this problem but may have cured others.

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS
Anaconda3-5.2.0-Linux-x86_64.sh
cuda_9.2.88_396.26_linux.run
cudnn-9.2-linux-x64-v7.1.tgz
openjdk-11-jre-headless
gcc-4.8, g++-4.8

Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package up-to-date:
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package
INFO: Elapsed time: 1806.409s, Critical Path: 138.18s
INFO: 6930 processes, local.
INFO: Build completed successfully, 7875 total actions

Hope it helps

body:
Add the following to your path:
/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.8

I added the following to .bashrc
export PATH=/usr/lib/gcc/x86_64-linux-gnu/4.8${PATH:+:${PATH}}

All cc1 and cc1plus errors are now gone during basel compile.

FYI, I also compiled basel 0.14.1 using gcc-4.8 as well, not sure if this is necessary. This alone did not cure this problem but may have cured others.

Ubuntu 18.04 LTS
Anaconda3-5.2.0-Linux-x86_64.sh
cuda_9.2.88_396.26_linux.run
cudnn-9.2-linux-x64-v7.1.tgz
openjdk-11-jre-headless
gcc-4.8, g++-4.8

Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package
INFO: Elapsed time: 1806.409s, Critical Path: 138.18s
INFO: 6930 processes, local.
INFO: Build completed successfully, 7875 total actions

Hope it helps
